main event: A radar target was detected over Camp Pendleton, California, at approximately 750 feet, moving in a northerly direction for about 2-3 minutes before disappearing into a cloud.
interesting points: The radar target appeared 4-5 miles wide and moved at twice the speed of a jet aircraft., The object was circular shaped and silverish blue in color., There were two jet aircraft flying at approximately 4,000 feet in the opposite direction shortly before the sighting., The object was observed visually from the ground and was at an angle of elevation of approximately 70 degrees., Conclusions regarding the object were inconclusive, with possibilities including it being an aircraft or balloon.
witness description: MAJ James G Cashman, USMC, S-4 Officer, 7th Communication Battalion
